result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 15CF337

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.   AMENDED 02-20-2018:  Alcohol provision to be at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Transcript of Motion on Postconviction Relief Hearing on 2-20-18
Appeals Document Index saved for: 2018AP000570 by: Bonnie Nagy
Appeals consolidated (15CF337 & 15CF1542) for purposes of briefing and disposition.
Transcript of Jury Trial on 2/18/16
Notice of Appeal and court record has been received by COA.
Copy of Motion to COA to consolidate appeals
AMENDED Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Dianne M Erickson
Denying Postconviction Motion BUT Granting in Part (JOC AMENDED ON 02-20-2018)
Modifying alcohol provision in that "alcohol provision to be at discretion of agent."

Court Reporter:  Ellen Walfoort. Defendant Onansis A Roach in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Onansis A Roach in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Re Motion to Correct Defective Record:
BTC:  Re:  #1 - modification allowed, #3 allowed, #4 allowed and #2 allowed.  

RE: Motion for new trial because defendant's request to represent himself was denied.
Per Atty Erickson, defendant requested to represent himself or have stand-by counsel.
Per State, no prejudice, defendant never brought up self-representation in any subsequent hearings.
Per Atty Erickson, prejudice doesn't have to shown if structural error.
BTC:  Ms. Walker was not forced on the defendant and the defendant didn't indicate he wanted to represent himself in any of at least 5 subsequest hearings.  Stand-by counsel is not used in this court.   Motion denied.

RE:  Motion to Resentence Defendant:
Atty Erickson requests that alcohol provision be either removed or at discretion of the agent.
BTC:  JOC to be modified for alcohol provision to be at discretion of the agent.

Atty Erickson questions whether the defendant received a harsher sentence because he went to trial than if he had taken the DA's deal, as the DA's recommendation at sentencing was harsher than their plea deal offer. 
BTC:  Court not bound by deals and offers when sentencing.
The State indicates that the defendant's sentence was not unusually harsh and the court articulated the reasons at the time of sentencing.
BTC:  The Court determines sentences under Galleon, and is not bound by the DA's recommendation.  That would apply even if the defendant would have taken the DA's offer and plead instead of going to trial. Motion denied, no resentencing.

Atty Erickson will prepare an order for appeal purposes.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Cts 1 & 2: Not used, for file purposes only
Cts 1 & 2: Guilty
DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING

Defendant Onansis A Roach in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Onansis A Roach in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght (1st part of day)     Court Reporter Leslie Johnson. (2nd part of day)
Inv. Schlitz is still on the witness stand, remains under oath. Direct by State. State marks Ex #35-38; photos. State moves Ex #35 & 38 into evidence/received & published. Cross xam by defense. Defense asks that Ex #8 be published to the jury/granted. State marks Ex #39-Stipulation. State moves all exhibits into evidence/all are received. State rests. Defense motions for a verdict in favor of deft as they do not feel the State has met its burden. BTC: motion is denied. Defense indicates deft does not with to testify. The Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding his right to remain silent and his right to testify. Defense rests. The jury is excused while parties review jury instructions. The State gives closing arguments. Defense gives closing arguments. Rebuttal by State. The Court instructs the jury. Oath #4 given to bailiff's. Jury begins deliberations.
2:31 pm - the jury has a question, parties assembled. The jury has reached their verdict @ 3:05 pm

We the jury find the defendant:
GUITY - Cts 1-8 in 15CF337
GUILTY - Cts 1 & 2 of amended information in 15CF1542

The jury is polled. State moves for judgments on verdict. Defense moves for judgments not withstanding the verdict


BTC: Judgments on verdict is granted. Defendant is to be held without bond pending sentencing. PSI ordered. The order restricting phone calls will be lifted

Defendant Onansis A Roach in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Onansis A Roach in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Ted Schlitz/RPD is the State's representative. Jury enters, Oath #2 is given. Ms. Riek gives opening statements for the State. Ms. Walker gives opening statements for the defense. 
State calls AD - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #1-DVD/video footage from SCHS, Ex #3-7: photos; rec;d/published. Cross by defense. State calls AC - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State calls RT - DSAT. Direct by the State.
State calls Officer Heriberto Benitez - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State calls Sgt. Joe Stevens - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State calls Officer Luis Aguilar - DSAT. Direct by the State. State calls Officer Mark Haleen - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. State calls Officer Kristin Mireles - DSAT. Direct by the State. State calls Criminalist Todd Hoover - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex 8-10; photos, 11-DVD of phone calls, 12-17; Photos, 18- Cell phone-Galaxy Prevail; 19-DVD of cell phone download; #20-29-Photos. State moves Ex #24-29 into evidence/Received & published. Cross xam by defense. State calls Inv. Theodore Schlitz - DSAT. Direct by the State. Court adjourns for the evening. The State will admit the exhibits infront of the jury but for the record, the State moves Ex #1-34 into evidence. No objection/so received.

Defendant Onansis A Roach in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Onansis A Roach in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Parties are ready to proceed. The State puts the last offer on the record. Defense indicates that Mr. Roach rejects the State's offer. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant. BTC: The Court is satisfied that the defendant is freely, knowingly and voluntarily rejecting the offer at this time. The State files amended information in 15CF1542. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same; NG plea entered. 
Jury enters at 3:21 pm. Oath #1 given. Ms. Riek introduces self and members of her office as well as witnesses. Ms. Walker introduces self. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by Ms. Riek for the State. Voir dire by Ms. Walker for the defense. Parties exercise there peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen. No objections to the jury panel as chosen. Ms. Riek notes some issues on the record. 

BTC: deft and parties in the courtroom are admonished not to attempt to communicate with each other and deft is admonished that he is not to have phone privileges

Defendant Onansis A Roach in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Onansis A Roach in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State calls Inv. Theodore Schlitz - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #1-Miranda rights card. No cross by defense. State moves Ex #1 into evidence/Received.
RE: motion for joinder - parties give argument
RE: final pretrial. Parties are prepared to proceed; no Daubert issues, no lab issues. Parties expect trial to last 2 days

BTC: statement may be used in the State's case in chief and rebuttal. Regarding joinder, the Court believes that they are close in time and so related that although there is some prejudice, it is not overwhelming prejudice and therefore the cases can be joined. Regarding final pretrial: Officer Schlitz may be the State's representative. 5 strikes, 1 alternate.
for joinder

Defendant Onansis A Roach in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Onansis A Roach in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
defense asks for JT. Defense is asking for speedy trial. The State will be requesting hearing on joinder for 15CF337 and 15CF1542

BTC: speedy trial request must be in writing. Ms. Walker has until 12/16 by 5:00 pm today. Trial will be on 15CF337  Motion hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 03:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
